photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674157.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Since I already have a number of  bananas in my freezer... (my daughter's husband, her then boyfriend, used to say that it wasn't a normal trip to our freezer without the traditional black bananas. One time I found my freezer to be overcrowded and counted 46 frozen bananas. Sheesh! Time to bake or purge!) Anyway, I digress….I decided to bake something banana-y today with the almost-too-ripe bananas on my counter. Banana muffins! I settled on this recipe because it was super-duper simple. My subs/additions were pretty basic: brown for white sugar, an extra banana instead of the fat, a teaspoon of vanilla, a cup of chopped walnuts…all things that are purely to my own taste. The batter tasted yummy raw and filled twelve regular sized muffin cups and twelve mini-muffin cups. The muffins are in the oven now and have risen nicely. Tick tock, tick tock…Mine are taking a bit longer to bake although the minis were done in 15 min. And the minis are WONDERFUL hot! Moist, light and flavourful. Yippee!! The regular sized muffins have taken 20 minutes to bake. I have learned the hard way, after many many many years of tough nasty muffins, to just barely mix the wet into the dry. Resist the temptation to take your frustrations out on the muffin batter. Note: I think I like this recipe better as a mini-muffin. The reg sized muffins are a bit more soggy and just barely done, although still delicious. I dub this recipe a success!

This is the exact same recipe I have been using for years except that I add 1/2 tsp. cinnamon and throw in some fruit and walnuts.  I usually use either dried cranberries or chopped dates for the fruit.  I don't measure the fruit or nuts, but just toss some in until it looks right.  I always make them in the extra large muffin pan.  The recipe makes six of the large muffins.  It is a pretty foolproof recipe.

text:
I doubled the recipe since I had 6 very ripe bananas to use.  Only change I made was to substitute raw cane sugar instead of regular sugar.  I didn't bother sifting the dry ingredients and just ensured I mixed it well once added.  I didn't use a mixer and instead just used a spoon to combine the ingredients.  I like my muffins a little crispy on the outside so I had left them in the oven for two extra minutes.  The inside still stayed moist.

text:
Made these today, perfect! I wanted a healthier muffin for school mornings for my kids so I substituted in whole wheat white flour and 1/3 + 1 tbsp vanilla Greek yogurt for butter (or 1 small 5.3 ounce yogurt Cup). I added 1/4 Cup walnuts for high omega 3 content and 1/3 C choc chips to help sweeten from the wheat flour. Best muffins ever! Kids don't even realize they're getting high fiber and other stuff I feel better about feeding them! Thanks for the perfect starter recipe!

i would definitely not beat them lightly mix them and using an ice cream scoopper is a good way to get the batter into the tins

text:
This is a very quick easy recipe to put together. 
It's also quite versatile so you can add your own changes as needed. I did not have 3 over ripe bananas, only 2, so I also added some leftover coconut cream that I had in the fridge, along with 1/2 tsp vanilla and a few  dashes of cinnamon. 

Made 12 good sized muffins that are delicious! 

I think a person could easily substitute any other item they wanted to use instead of bananas, thinking pumpkin would also be good or even some mashed up sweet potato.

This was the second time making these muffins and I am so glad I decided to go with this one again! This recipe is spot on...it yielded 8 big muffins (they went over each of the top of the muffin tin cutouts..but I like them like that.) To the flour mixture, I added some spices: cinnamon/nutmeg/cardamom (not measured, just sprinkled in) and I also added chopped almonds and dark chocolate slivers.  I cooked them in a 350/375 degree oven for approx. 27 minutes to make sure they were cooked.
Really really good. My friend ate 3 in one sitting!! Thank you for sharing this recipe!

Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674162.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
The most important part of making these muffins is to let them rest!! Otherwise, you won't get a nice rounded crown on them. I mix the batter, put it into tins, and THEN I turn the oven on to preheat. This is all the time it needs, but it's crucial. I found this out by accident. The first time I made them, I got distracted and they sat on the counter in tins for about 5-10minutes before I noticed and threw them in the oven. The next time I made them, I threw them right into the oven and they came out so flat and unappealing. It took a couple more times of making them this way before I realized the discrepancy and decided to wait a few minutes. It's works like magic every time now. 
1/3 cup chocolate chips always makes it into the batter in our house. And I usually add 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice and 1 tsp vanilla.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2015-10-24T09:58:20.217
helpfulCount:

city:

country:
None
text:
I made a healthy version of the recipe and got delicious results as well.

Here are the alterations:
1. 1/3 c apple sauce instead of butter
2. 1.5 c oat flour instead of white flour
3. 1.5 tsp baking soda instead of 1 (add a little extra salt as well)
4. 1/2 cup of agave instead of 3/4 cup of white sugar
5. 1-2 tsp vanilla extract and about 1 tsp. of cinnamon

Hope this was helpful! enjoy:)

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe was ok in my opinion. I've done a lot of baking and honestly this one just didn't excite me. It was a little bit denser than I prefer. I made it exactly as the recipe suggested. However, I did add chocolate chips and walnuts to it but these ingredients should not have altered the density of the muffins. The flavor was good (although slightly bitter from the baking soda which is typical for banana-based sweets). I would recommend trying folding in the egg white after beating it to stiff peaks in place of half of the baking soda. This way you add a physical (natural) leavener in place of a chemical one. This should help with the bitterness and the density.

text:
Hi! After using all-recipes for a LONG time, this recipe finally made me join, to write a review. The recipe is DELIGHTFUL! I followed the tips from the comments, left out a banana because I didn't have enough, and instead added blueberry, and whipped up a crumble to go on top. So moist, filling, and even without one banana, the banana flavor is strong. I absolutely love this recipe and will make it my go-to muffin recipe. One tip to give, Make SURE you use bananas that have been sitting and have a fair amount of brown spots. These are sweeter and softer. And like all the other tips, just mix until the mixture is moist. Once again, great recipe! I tried to upload a picture but it wouldn't go through... Anyway, Thanks again!

country:
None
text:
After mashing the bananas, I added about 1/4 c. brown sugar to them (instead of into the dry ingredients, as I had already sifted).  Then I added the melted butter and egg.  I gave it a good whir with my immersion blender to make it more of a puree.  I dumped the sifted, dry ingredients into the wet ingredients bowl and gently stirred/folded just until blended and moist.  At 350 degrees, it only took 20 mins (regular sized muffins).  The texture is sublime.  Here's a pic.  Sorry, two are missing; can you blame us?

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
These bake up very nicely. I topped the muffins with chopped walnuts, which I highly suggest for appearance and texture. I got 12 muffins, exactly, with a #16 scoop. I sprayed my non-stick pan with Bakers Joy and they removed effortlessly after cooling slightly. My only issue was these reminded me very much like banana bread and not a banana muffin cut open and when tasted. The only difference is these are slightly sweeter and very soft. I would consider them an easily portioned banana bread, if craving that. My only change was the garnish and subbing a 1/2 cup of the flour for white whole wheat. I would make these for a banana bread lover.

text:
This is my go-to recipe for banana muffins. It makes a dozen regular sized muffins, and I add 1 tsp. vanilla to the wet mixture and 1/2 tsp cinnamon to the dry mixture. I also add chopped pecans to final mix (for personal preference). This recipe is also great as a bread loaf; just be sure to adjust cook times 10-15 minutes.

Good solid recipe, but set your timer for 20 minutes - in my oven, 25 would have been disastrous. Couldn't have been any easier to whip this up! My sister tried to make herself some banana bread the other day and we'll just say... It didn't go so well. So I figured I'd fix her some muffins and these were fantastic! I followed the recipe exactly as written, no additions or substitutions at all. They were moist, had an excellent flavor, and were very fluffy. I think it's the absolute perfect base recipe, as the possibility for additions are endless. 
I wrote it down for my sister, so hopefully the next time she feels the need to (gulp) try to bake, it won't be a disappointing fiasco.

country:
None
text:
This is a very easy recipe. I've made it many times with good, consistent result. I've made it as is, and i've also made it with some modification. Here's my modification:
Instead of 1/3 cup melted butter, i use 1/6 cup plain full-fat yogurt and 1/6 cup olive oil. Instead of white sugar, i use brown sugar. I've also baked it in a 9 x 3.5 inch loaf pan instead of muffins. For this, i made a topping, which ups the yummy factor by about 5 times. This is the topping recipe i use:
1/4 cup brown sugar, about 2 tablespoon very soft butter, 1/4 cup plain flour, about 25 grams chopped pecans. Mix everything together and spread on the batter before putting into the oven.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674149.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is my go to banana muffin recipe. It's so moist and DELICIOUS. I like to use oil instead of butter (preferably olive oil) and when I can't use eggs I use  2 tbsp water mixed with 1 tbsp of oil and 2 tbsp of baking powder and it makes the muffins rise so much more! I also up the sugar to 1 cup when I use the egg substitute(which I now always do) and sometimes even use honey instead of sugar and they turn out great( if you are going to use honey once you get past 1 cup of it reduce it by 1/4 cup. For example if you are doubling the recipe instead of using 1 1/2 cup, use 1 1/4 cup). Add ins go really well in them. My top two are chocolate and walnuts. If you haven't give this recipe a try, go for it. You won't be disappointed.

text:
Excellent and simple! The only thing I changed was I added some nuts. I had a few pecans in the freezer but I wanted more nuts. Searching... ahhh! Slivered almonds, check! Great flavor combo! I didn't add vanilla or cinnamon or nutmeg or replace the butter with applesauce... and if I had, I wouldn't be reviewing THIS recipe. Nuts is a personal preference, but the base of this recipe is just wonderful and I wouldn't change a thing. I did do this though...  I wanted a nice high crown, so I made 10 muffins instead of 12. And I think the butter caused them to brown a little more than I had expected, but that was strictly visual. Great recipe, I'm keeping it in my recipe box!

text:
Excellent as is but can make it healthier without much change in taste.  Use all white whole wheat flour and decrease sugar to 1/2 cup and oil to 1/4 cup with enough applesauce to equal the 1/3 cup for moisture.  Aldo sub egg white for whole egg to decrease fat a bit.  I make it regularly like this and whole family enjoys.

userID:
12240900
Display Name:
This_is_me
isPro:

1

recipesCount:

reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614256.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Great muffin, it has a great taste. As per someone's suggestion I made the mix the night before and baked it this morning. In the mix I used LACTOSE FREE margarine instead of melted butter. I didn't melt the margarine, just mixed it in, because I figured margarine's soft and will mix no problem. I also didn't use the whole 1/3 cup, and the muffins were still moist. I didn't over-mix. While mixing, the batter looked like it had too much flour, it had a thick consistency to it,but it turned out great; I just mixed until it was combined and left it in the fridge for the night. It was very easy to fill the muffin cups. It made 12 average sized muffins. They rose wonderfully and look so good! I waited until they cooled and ate two. You can definitely taste the banana, in a pleasant way. The flavour of the banana plus the sweetness (I guess from the sugar and/or sweetness of the banana?) are what you can taste the most, so if you're worried this recipe won't have flavour, don't be, it has plenty. However, the aftertaste is pretty sweet so next time I'm going to cut down the sugar by 1 or 2 TBSP and see how that turns out. I don't think it'll make too much of a difference because it's pretty sweet. Great recipe with ingredients I have on hand!
Review:

text:
This is the best recipe ever. They are so moist and taste awesome. I made some for my sisters birthday because she is going somewhere next week and she wanted them as a snack. She tasted them and she said they were really good. 
She and a few other family members think it would taste better with chocolate chips, but it was good without them as well. The muffins were moist and tender... They were just so good. They had wonderful results. One time I made muffins with a different recipe and they didn't rise very high in the oven and they tasted like flour. I threw them all away. It was a big waste of ingredients if you ask me. Every time my family has mushy bananas, we either make  muffins or banana bread.

I used 3 tsp baking powder for the soda, used brown sugar instead of white, and used 1/2 a cup of whole wheat flour instead of the 1/2 cup of white. I added 1/2 tsp of vanilla and toasted some slivered almonds and sprinkeled on top just before putting them in the oven. I used a large mufin tin and the recipe made just enough for 6 jumbo muffins. They were perfect at 25 min and ooh so good!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Great flavor and texture, super easy to make. I did add a little bit of cinnamon and clove...just enough to complement the banana flavor without dominating.  I do think they would be good with half all-purpose flour and half whole wheat flour or with some applesauce and a bit less butter. Brown sugar for all or part of the white sugar would be nice for variety, too. I always keep ripe bananas in the freezer, ready to go for muffins, cookies, smoothies or just pureed for dessert. They thawed easily in the microwave to mash for this recipe. 

We've also made them with blueberries mixed in (just toss fresh or unthawed frozen blueberries with a little of the dry mixture, then fold them in at the end). We otherwise left the recipe as listed.

text:
I don't understand how this recipe has 5 stars.  I followed the recipe exactly, and the batter was extremely runny.  I added some more flour to try to thicken it, and it only sort of worked.  I decided to go ahead and put it in the oven, and after a few minutes, there was a strong burning smell.  I looked in the oven to find that the muffin tins were running over and spilling over the side of the tin and onto the bottom of the oven.  I had only filled the tins about 2/3 full, so this shouldn't have happened.  I gave it a few more minutes, and it continued to get worse, so I finally gave up and turned the oven off and removed the tins.  I have made banana muffins many times before, but I must not have used this recipe, because they have always turned out great before.  I am never using this recipe again.

I turned this into a great recipe for 24 cupcakes/muffins. I doubled all ingredients listed except the bananas (I didn't have 6 so I used just 3) and added cinnamon, 1 tsp vanilla and 1/2 cup applesauce (batter was too dry otherwise). I mixed by hand with a spoon. Don't ovemix, Don't overcook and use cupcake papers. So good!

text:
Oh my gosh - there's no way to mess these up!  I've added too much banana, had to use nearly a cup of corn flour, and they still turn out.  I don't use butter or jelly when serving because they already taste so buttery.  We've been making tons of mini-muffins since we found this recipe.

There are two keys to making muffins, so as long as you don't mix too much and don't overbake, these will always be great for you!  When baking, your muffins are done with you can lightly push the top in and it springs back.  It you make a dent, you'll have to wait.

I have made this recipe a total of five times using the suggestions from earlier posts as a guide along with what's printed.  I find that old bananas (yes the ones with black skins) make the best muffins and I also use six instead of the printed three and a cup of sugar too. I read the reviews and decided to use cinnamon applesauce instead of butter and added a touch of vanilla.  I made 24 mini muffins in the little paper cups and poured the rest of the batter into a mini loaf pan.  The mini muffins cooked up well in about 23 minutes, but they stuck to the paper cups; I've never had to spray the paper cups before but perhaps I should have?  I'm still waiting on the banana bread as it wasn't cooked at the 30-min mark.  I'm not sure if I'll try this recipe again because my old standby banana bread recipe is really the best one I've tried.

text:
These are just good, normal, easy-to-make banana muffins. I made them exactly as the recipe said and they are very quick and easy. I think if I added just a little more sugar and banana they would taste like the Otis Spunkmeyer muffins. They are very light colored, so take them out before they brown. Mine were still light on top but the bottoms were just a teensy bit over cooked. Next time I'll take them out a minute sooner.

text:
Great use of leftover bananas.  Next time you have a brown banana hanging around, toss it in the freezer in a ziplock bag.  After a few weeks, you should have enough to whip up a batch or two of these easy and delicious muffins - all the ingredients already on hand.  I use a potato masher to smash my bananas up well.  Toss in some mini-chocolate chips, too.  Not too many, just enough to add a little richness. 
Everyone loves these!

text:
These are so easy to make and so delicious! My family all agree that it was one of the best tasting muffins they've ever tried! Unlike some of the users have suggested, I did not add any spices to the mixed, but I've made a few alternations to this recipe: 1) I used brown sugar instead of white 2)replaced butter with canola oil. It came out really great, moist and light. I would say the key is to use really ripened bananas and to gently fold the dry ingredients in.

text:
This is so easy to make and everyone loves it.  I made some modifications.
I used whole wheat and organic pastry flower.
Substituted the white sugar with natural "sugar in the raw"
And used safflower oil instead of butter.
Sifting is essential and FOLD the dry ingredients into the wet.
I used a nonstick muffin pan and didn't need to "grease" the pan.
Fantastic

text:
These were good. I had two, almost rotting bananas that I needed to get rid of. Even though this recipe calls for 3 bananas, I used it. And they came out great :) The only changes I made was 2 bananas instead of 3, I added in 1/4 teaspoon of vanilla and 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon (to make up on flavor for the missing banana). Also, as I was making them, I started craving something chocolaty so I threw in about 1/4 cup of chocolate chips and about 1/8 cup a mini chocolate chips (I didn't have enough regular chocolate chips left). But everything came out great! I baked 12 regular muffins @ 350 for about 23 minutes. I will deff be making these again, the same way I just did but maybe take them out at 20 minutes. (mine were a tiny tiny bit dry, but still so flavorful and awesome!) Thanks for the recipe :)

Display Name:
j'adorelacuisine

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/837636.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I really wanted to make banana muffins but I didn't have eggs so I used this recipe with alterations. I increased the amount of baking powder by about 1/4 teaspoon and added juice. The juice was Bolthouse Farms C-Boost...it has mangos, pears, and cherries, but you really can't taste that once the muffins are baked. I added the juice in order to improve the texture of the batter. Without eggs, the texture can be extremely dense. If you're going to use juice, I suggest pouring in a little bit at a time, mixing it in, and then seeing if you need more. You don't want to spoil the batter by using too heavy of a hand. 
These turned out delicious and fluffy, and they could easily be made vegan by just replacing the butter with an oil!

Loved the muffins!! I did alterations to my recipe - used whole wheat flour (sifted it with the dry ingredients), added 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 1/2 cup shredded coconut, 1/2 cup brown sugar, handful roasted walnut pieces and decorated the top of each muffin with a roasted pecan. I got a dozen muffins which were in the oven for 20 mins and they came out looking beautiful.

Delicious and quick, I mash 3 bananas at a time when they are not going to be consumed fast enough and freeze in zip lock bags for use at a later date. text:
Second time rating this recipe and have to say it's gotten to the point that I buy bananas and patiently watch them rippen so I can make this recipe! Love it and have only changed the baking time. I reduced it to under 20 minutes for large muffins (lower baking time for smaller muffins). Make sure your bananas are very ripe, almost mushy and it's ok to fold until all is mixed. Reduce baking time keeps them moist.

text:
I've used this recipe three times now! First time I followed it exactly and they were great! Second time I used 1 cup whole wheat flour and 1/2 a cup all purpose, and they were okay but a little too wheat tasting. Third time I used half WW half all purpose flour and used just over 1/2 a cup of pure organic coconut sugar instead of the 3/4 cup of white sugar as it calls for and they are DELICIOUS! Best yet!! And coconut sugar is so much better for you. Highly recommend trying this!! Also I found that it can easily make 18 muffins if you just don't fill the cups right to the top.

text:
I made these this afternoon. they turned out great. I did use 4 bananas because that's what I had and I always throw in extra banana when doing banana bread so figured it wouldn't hurt.   I can't vouch for the butter in the recipe but I'm sure its great. I used 1/3 c. coconut oil instead of 1/3 cup butter. I also mixed in about a cup of flaked coconut. I tried one right out of the oven (too hot to hold) because I couldn't wait and it was good, but I thought could be sweeter.  but when I tried one again later after they were cool I found they were sweet enough and I really like them.   this recipe is a easy fast recipe to throw together and can easily be adjusted for taste (less sweet/more sweet) mix ins, etc.   i will be making these again when i have over ripe bananas to use up.

text:
I added 1tsp vanilla, 1tsp cinnamon, swapped the oil for butter and added chocolate chips. It turned out moist and fluffy. Flavour was really good. I made sure not to overmix or overbake. Checked the muffins with a skewer every 2 mins after the first 10 mins and they were ready in about 15 mins. Funny thing is the tops of the muffins became quite damp the next day. Don't know why that is. Maybe because of condensation? And I live in a humid area. Will definitely make again. So fast and simple!

text:
I really love this! It's so incredibly moist. It is a little sweeter than i thought, but that may be becasue the bananas i used were very ripe and sweet.   Like others I altered it slightly. I used 4 small-medium bananas (I didn't had large ones) and I added 1/2 tsp. of vanilla, and 1/2 tsp. of cinnamon. Also, I separated the egg and whipped the eggwhite into soft peaks. I folded in the other wet ingredients most of the way and then folded in the eggwhite. It made the muffins a bit more airy. I am very happy with the results.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674138.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I followed the recipe with a couple of additions: a pinch of cinnamon and 1/2 cup mini chocolate chips. I had to bake for 20 minutes for mini muffins. I mixed the dry ingredients together then sifted it over the wet ingredients. This resulted in less clumping which needed less stirring. Less stirring = soft muffins, not chewy. They were sooo good! I took them to work the next day and they disappeared in about an hour. With the modifications I made, this recipe yielded about 30 mini muffins. Next time I make this I'm going to also bake a few muffin tops. Mmm!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
excellent recipe. i made a few adjustments to make these vegan friendly and way less fattening. instead of egg and butter, i just substituted 1/2 cup of unsweetened applesauce. i also halved the white sugar to 1/2 cup, and also did about 1/4 cup of brown sugar. i used 2 jumbo over-ripened bananas with 1/4 cup of soymilk, 1 tsp of vanilla extract, 1 tsp of cinnamon, and 1 tsp of nutmeg. baked for 10 minutes, took them out half done and sprinkled cinnamon sugar on the tops, then back in for 8 more minutes. they turned out amazing! very moist, fluffy, sweet, and not too fattening.

text:
These are great! Extremely easy to make. I just made them to take to my grandfather who loves freshly baked goods. Not too sweet, either.  I used my mini muffin tins which cuts the cooking time down considerably.  It makes 48 mini muffins which is perfect for sending a special snack to school for the kids!  My daughters are eating them right up as I type.  I followed other users and added cinnamon and vanilla for extra flavour.  Folding the wet ingredients just enough with the dry ingredients is perfect.  The batter is thick and easy to fill the muffin tins with!   These would be fabulous with a small amount of chocolate chips in them!!

text:
This recipe was pretty fantastic! I DID change and add a few things, following advice from other reviewers or just because I wanted to. I used only 1/2 cup sugar, substituted oil for the butter, added 1/2 tsp of ground cinnamon, a pinch of nutmeg, a packet of vanilla sugar (I'm in Europe and haven't found vanilla extract yet) and a little bit of milk just because my batter seemed dry. They turned out great! Very moist and still a little sweeter than I expected (bananas are already sweet), but that's fine. It's definitely a keeper!.....Second time around I used only 1/2 cup sugar and substituted oil for the butter, added a dash of nutmeg, ginger and cinnamon. Made 12, baked for abt 17 mins to a golden brown. Hot and fresh they are GREAT! Moist and cakey like I like it, with a great banana flavor!

The absolute best muffins that I have ever made.  I am a terrible baker and this turned out wonderfully.  I tripled the recipe for my daughter's class.  I did not have butter, so I substituted 3 (4 oz) containers of banana flavored applesauce.  Gently mixed the batter and placed in the fridge overnight. Baked the next morning and the muffins were perfect. I also added a bit of vanilla and sprinkle of cinnamon to the batter.

text:
These are quite tasty! I only had 2 bananas so I tweaked the amount of ingredients as follows:1 cup flour 3/4 teaspoon baking powder and soda, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 2  bananas, 1 egg, 1/2 cup sugar and 3 tablespoons butter. They turned out light and fluffy.  I also did not mash the bananas as much to leave chunks in the muffins.  I will be making these again! Thanks!!

Wonderful! Turns out well everytime! Like everyone else, I separated the wet & dry ingredients. I added a cup of chopped pecans to the mix and garnished (some on top before baking) to look pretty. I also put a dash of cinnamon, vanilla extract, and nutmeg. I used mini muffin pans and filled 2/3 of it. I also watched the baking time carefully as it varies from each oven. It yielded half of what the recipe says it would (~24 instead of 48).

text:
These are the moistest muffins I've made so far. I was worried that something might have gone wrong because the bananas I used were not especially ripe, not to mention that I mashed them with a spatula. 

I mixed a few dashes of cinnamon and sprinkled some more on top when they were in pans. I didn't have nutmeg and I had been too absentminded to add vanilla.

They still turned out great!

Next time, I would cut back slightly on the sugar and try out vailla and nutmeg.

region:

country:
None
text:
After a few "enhancements" these are the perfect, healthy & kid-friendly muffins!
Use half whole wheat, half white flour. Cut down sugar to 1/2 cup. Omit butter, substitute applesauce, add 1/2 cup ground flax seed. Like other folks, I added cinnamon & vanilla. Sprinkle with diced, toasted pecans & lightly sprinkle with cinnamon & sugar before baking.  Easy, quick & delicious! Our family's favorite muffin recipe!

text:
My four year old helped me make these with great success (the help and the results).  I followed the advice of previous reviewers and added 1 tsp of vanilla, 1 tsp of cinnamon, and 1/4 tsp of nutmeg.  I used two ripe bananas and one not-so ripe banana (that's all I had) but it turned out well because the less ripe banana left small little pockets of banana in the baked muffin.  For us, this was exactly enough for 24 mini muffins; the baking time (with a completely preheated oven) was closer to 20 minutes. Perfect - I couldn't stop eating them!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
To make this a little healthier, I changed the recipe slightly. It comes out PERFECTLY and I'm still amazed at how good they taste. Instead of 3 bananas, I use 4 large bananas. I use only half of the butter that the recipe calls for (still melted) and also add 1/2 cup applesauce. I use 1/4 C. Splenda and 1/2 C. sugar, add 1 t. cinnamon, 1 t. nutmeg, 1 t. vanilla. I use the very large silicon muffin cups and bake at 35 for exactly half an hour. They turn out perfectly every time

This recipe made 12 full, light, and delicious banana muffins that my family couldn't get enough of. This is the best banana muffin recipe I have ever made. I made a double batch of this recipe so that we would have enough for snacks later. Not one complaint in my picky bunch.

This was hard for me to rate because I altered the recipe so much to make it healthy, but I will share what I did. 1) I added the 1 tsp cinnamon, 1\4 tsp nutmeg, and 1 tsp vanilla suggested by other reviewers 2) I used all whole wheat flour 3) I used unsweetened applesauce instead of butter. That said, they turned out to be a decent healthy treat. I made a dozen, and they came out to 2 Weight Watchers points each: 126 calories,

Extremely good muffins! I had a craving for chocolate chip banana muffins, but none of the recipes specifically for that were grabbing me. This one looked good though, so I decided to try it. I added a teaspoon of vanilla, and used half whole wheat flour and half white flour, but otherwise made the recipe as stated. (With the addition of miniature chocolate chips, as implied earlier.) The muffins turned out really well - nice and fluffy with a great flavor. I will definitely be keeping this recipe around to use again!

text:
Great basic banana muffin recipe!  I scaled down the recipe to one banana, as it was turning black in my kitchen-that means it was turning into a prime baking banana!  Because it called for 1/3 of an egg, I just used some leftover yolks, and it still came out delicious. If you use them, definitely use the liners that are paper/foil.  The muffins slid right out of the wrapping! (I've had some trouble with paper wrappers before.)

text:
Yummy and easy to make. I did use lo-fat sour cream in place of the butter. This is terrific basic recipe that you can tweak any way you like. Very easy to make and the whole family practically ate all of them. I bake at 325 degrees because I used mini muffin tins. I used 1/2 c. whole wheat flour and 1 c. white flour. I also added: 2 tblsps. flax seed - flax seed is really healthy for you and my family doesn't even notice; 1 tsp. cinnamon, 1 tsp. vanilla and 1 c. nuts. Thank you for the recipe - I've added it to my recipe box!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
These were great!  I made a few modifications and used some suggestions from others.  For example:

I used 4 large bananas, mashed 
I used Splenda instead of sugar (about 1/4 cup as we don't like sweet things but they were just the right sweetness)
I added 1 tsp. cinnamon and 1 tsp. vanilla

Instead of the butter I used a mixture of unsweetened applesauce (lunch box size) and mayo (an old trick a farmer's wife taught me, I do this with cakes too).

I added chopped pecans and golden raisins.  Oh drool ... these were sooooo moist and tender, not at all oily, probably because of the Hellmann's Mayo & applesauce.

I also sprinkled pecan pieces on top of the muffins before baking.  They were gone before I could make the cream cheese icing.  Oh well, next time I'll make the cream cheese icing ... I do intend to make this recipe again, thanks for sharing.

text:
Yum!  Lends itself well to healthy alterations.  I used 4 oz applesauce instead of butter, 1/2 cup Splenda instead of sugar, added 1 tsp vanilla extract & 1 tsp cinammon, plus a sprinkle or two of nutmeg.  Reduced oven temp to 325 F  as Splenda tends to make baked goods brown faster & baked for 25 minutes.  Very moist & tasty!

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614252.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
These are really good but I certainly wouldn't call them "healthy" - white flour, white sugar, etc. - the only healthy thing is the banana!

This is what I did to make them healthier:
-replace white flour with whole wheat pastry flour
-replace white sugar with Sucanat-this is a less refined sugar and I think has a much better taste-when I cook with it I let it "sit" a bit in the wet ingredients, so it will dissolve a little better
-3 Tablespoons ground flax seed
-1/2 of a vanilla bean

Now they are healthier, and still very good.
Review:

5

text:
These were great!! I added a splash of vanilla and substituted the Shedd's Spread Cinnamon flavored butter for the plain butter. I also used Self-rising flour and omitted the baking powder, salt, etc. My brother-in-law said they were the best muffins he has ever tasted and DH practically ate the whole panful!
